name: The Game of Life in GML
name_original: The Game of Life in GML
description:
The Game of Life is a cellular automaton designed by British mathematician John Horton Conway.

It works by creating a number of cells and applies two states (alive or dead) along with two rules that constantly alter the state of the cells.

You have two additional options that work for adding how many cells you want, and whether you want them to draw lines separating each cell or not

In addition to a button to see the data of the game and another to update the state of the cells only once

A PAUSE and PLAY system to constantly call the cellular update system or pause the call
